definition: band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise

sentences.english: These red little Japanese plums add a perky taste to stir-frys and soups.
sentences.chinese: 这种红色的日本小李子在炒菜和放汤时，味道很带劲。

sentences.english: The play has a powerful ending.
If there’s more people on the island, the more the merrier it is to make them all dance.
sentences.chinese: 来的人越多，我干起活也更带劲。

sentences.english: I was much happier in my old job.
sentences.chinese: 我做我原先的那份工作要带劲得多。

sentences.english: It is great fun and a good exercise as well.
sentences.chinese: 跳这种舞十分带劲，并且仍是一种很好的熬炼。

sentences.english: He jumped even harder and finally made it out.
sentences.chinese: 而那只蛙却跳得更带劲了，最后他成功地跳出了深坑。

sentences.english: The brute democratic sense of it all is very appealing.
sentences.chinese: 这种粗蛮的民主感觉真带劲儿。

sentences.english: How excitedly we danced just now.
sentences.chinese: 我们刚才跳得可带劲儿了。

definition: (dialect) to be full of zeal/high-spirited/exhilarating/to stir sb up
(neologism) (of movies, songs etc) affecting/touching/moving/(of a person, esp. a woman) charming/cool
to satisfy a craving/to get a kick out of sth/gratifying/immensely enjoyable/satisfying/fulfilling
lit. just the right flavor/just right/just the thing/excellent
to have no strength/to feel weak/exhausted/feeling listless/boring/of no interest
to feel great/blissful/to be in bliss
erhua variant of 沒勁|没劲[mei2 jin4]
